TEST.0.title: 2024 North Carolina Division B Regional 2
TEST.0.customHeader:
Names of participants: (Please print neatly)

School Name:

Check your team: ◻ Varsity ◻ JV1 JV2 ◻ JV3

Warning: Do not open this packet until given permission to do so.

Note: There are useful notes after this page.

CIPHER.58.cipherString: To me, all research is exploring the universe, understanding it deeper, one finding at a time.
CIPHER.58.question: Decode this quote from Meeta Ahluwalia which has been encoded with an Aristocrat Cipher.
CIPHER.58.author: Meeta Ahluwalia

CIPHER.80.cipherString: Good manners are part of good morals.
CIPHER.80.question: The following quote by Whately. needs to be decoded with the Affine Cipher where a=23 and b=23.
CIPHER.80.author: Whately.

CIPHER.62.cipherString: Anyone who thinks onions are the only vegetable that can make you cry has never dropped a cabbage on their toe.
CIPHER.62.question: A quote from an unknown source has been encoded using the K1 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode. You are told that it ends with TOE.
CIPHER.62.author: Unknown

CIPHER.70.cipherString: To really live a life in search of knowledge, you must admit when you are wrong.
CIPHER.70.question: Solve this quote from Jason Fagone which has been encoded with the Atbash Cipher.
CIPHER.70.author: Jason Fagone

CIPHER.64.cipherString: The constant man loses not his virtue in misfortune. A torch may point towards the ground, but its flame will still point upwards.
CIPHER.64.question: Solve this quote by Bhartrihari that has been encoded as a Patristocrat using a K2 keyword.  You are told that nothing it contains two occurrences of the letters ILL.
CIPHER.64.author: Bhartrihari

CIPHER.59.cipherString: Poets and heroes are of the same race; the latter do what the former conceive.
CIPHER.59.question: The following quote by Alphonse de Lamartine needs to be decoded with the Porta Cipher with a keyword of WISH.
CIPHER.59.author: Lamartine.

CIPHER.66.cipherString: Eye red receipts the same weigh eye red sigh-uns fiction. Eye get to the end and eye thinque, well, that's knot going to hap-in.
CIPHER.66.question: Decode the message from an unknown source which was encoded with a K1 Aristocrat Cipher (after being run through a ‘sus' dictation system).
CIPHER.66.author: unknown

CIPHER.61.cipherString: You are not born with knowledge; you have to learn it. You are not born with wisdom; you have to earn it.
CIPHER.61.question: Decode this quote from Debasish Mridha which has been encoded with a Caesar Cipher.
CIPHER.61.author: Debasish Mridha

CIPHER.82.cipherString: Selfishness is that detestable vice which no one will forgive in others, and no one is without in himself.
CIPHER.82.question: A quote by Henry Ward Beecher has been encoded using the K1 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode. You are told that it ends with SELF.
CIPHER.82.author: BEECHER

CIPHER.78.cipherString: Poetry is to prose as dancing is to walking.
CIPHER.78.question: The following odd symbols were found on a sheet of paper when a tomb was opened, but you recognized it as the Baconian alphabet, written by a prankster. It turns out to be a quote by John Wain.  What does it say?
CIPHER.78.author: John Wain

CIPHER.68.cipherString: Gravity explains the motions of the planets, but it cannot explain who sets the planets in motion.
CIPHER.68.question: A quote by Isaac Newton has been encoded using the K1 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.
CIPHER.68.author: Isaac Newton

CIPHER.71.question: The following cryptarithm provides the key to decoding the values 4071968 2930465. What do they decode to?

CIPHER.76.cipherString: Do just once what others say you can't do, and you will never pay attention to their limitations again.
CIPHER.76.question: Decode this quote from James R. Cook which has been encoded with an Aristocrat Cipher.
CIPHER.76.author: James R. Cook

CIPHER.72.cipherString: Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.
CIPHER.72.question: Decode this quote from Thomas Jefferson which has been encoded with the Complete Columnar Cipher.  You are told that it contains the letters WILLD.
CIPHER.72.author: Thomas Jefferson

CIPHER.60.cipherString: Success is focusing the full power of all you are on what you have a burning desire to achieve.
CIPHER.60.question: Decode this quote from Wilfred Peterson which has been encoded with an Aristocrat Cipher.
CIPHER.60.author: Wilfred Peterson

CIPHER.67.cipherString: Honourable is a word of high rank, and implies much more than most people attach to it.
CIPHER.67.question: Decode this quote from Ernst Moritz Arndt which has been encoded with the Complete Columnar Cipher.  You are told that it contains the letters KANDIM.
CIPHER.67.author: Arndt.

CIPHER.63.cipherString: A good king is a public servant.
CIPHER.63.question: The following quote by Ben Jonson needs to be decoded with the Affine Cipher where a=21 and b=4.
CIPHER.63.author: Ben Jonson.

CIPHER.73.cipherString: Sure, winning isn't everything. It's the only thing.
CIPHER.73.question: The following strange headlines encode a quote by Henry 'Red' Sanders using a Baconian cipher. You are told that the deciphered text starts with SURE.
CIPHER.73.author: Henry 'Red' Sanders

CIPHER.65.cipherString: One of the greatest pieces of economic wisdom is to know what you do not know.
CIPHER.65.question: The following quote by John Kenneth Galbraith needs to be decoded with the Nihilist Substitution Cipher with a keyword of GERMS and polybius key of MICROBIOLOGY.
CIPHER.65.author: John Kenneth Galbraith

CIPHER.81.cipherString: I think of myself as a bad writer with big ideas, but I'd rather be that than a big writer with bad ideas.
CIPHER.81.question: A quote by Michael Moorcock has been encoded using the K2 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.
CIPHER.81.author: Michael Moorcock

CIPHER.74.question: The following cryptarithm provides the key to decoding the values 7016523 189542. What do they decode to?

CIPHER.69.cipherString: Do not say a little in many words, but a great deal in few!
CIPHER.69.question: The following letters encode a phrase by Pythagoras using a Baconian alphabet. What does it say?
CIPHER.69.author: Pythagoras

CIPHER.77.cipherString: Sometimes you must dangle your feet in the water to attract the sharks.
CIPHER.77.question: The following quote by Sherlock Holmes needs to be decoded with the Nihilist Substitution Cipher with a keyword of COLD and polybius key of THERMOMETER.
CIPHER.77.author: Sherlock Holmes

CIPHER.75.cipherString: Nobility of soul is more honourable than nobility by birth.
CIPHER.75.question: A Dutch Proverb has been encoded using the FractionatedMorse Cipher for you to decode. You are told that the quote has OUL IS in it corresponding to the encoded text G P L B Y R I W.
CIPHER.75.author: Dutch Proverb

CIPHER.79.cipherString: Si te enfocas en los resultados, nunca cambiarás. Si te enfocas en el cambio, obtendrás resultados.
CIPHER.79.question: Solve this Xenocrypt which is a translation of a quote by Jack Dixon into Spanish and has been encoded with a K1 alphabet using an English keyword.  It starts with SI TE.
CIPHER.79.author: Jack Dixon
CIPHER.79.translation: If you focus on results, you will never change. If you focus on change, you will get results.
